elements.title: Ecovadis
elements.description: The EcoVadis sustainability intelligence suite spans the full spectrum of sustainability risk and performance management with broad-scale supply chain risk screening and mapping, reliable scorecards with actionable ratings, and complete audit and improvement management.

elements.title: Manifest Climate
elements.description: Manifest Climate, a Toronto, Canada-based climate intelligence SaaS+ aims at giving businesses the tools, data, and support needed to build climate confidence and TCFD (Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures) reporting. Raised 30M CAD in [April 2022](https://www.finsmes.com/2022/03/manifest-climate-raises-cad30m-in-series-a-funding.html)

elements.title: DNV
elements.description: Giant group DNV are the independent expert in assurance and risk management, headquartered in Oslo with operations in more than 100 countries. They have a [part of the business](https://www.dnv.com/power-renewables/services/testing/battery-storage.html) dedicated to storage. In [December 2020](https://www.dnv.com/news/dnv-gl-performs-technical-due-diligence-for-gore-street-energy-storage-fund-s-acquisition-of-anesco-s-81-mw-uk-operational-battery-storage-portfolio-192425), selected by Gore Street Capital to undertake a range of technical due diligence services on an 81 MW operational battery storage portfolio.

elements.title: Cervest
elements.description: Cervest offers cloud-based Climate Intelligence (CI) to empower enterprises, governments and financial services companies to manage and adapt to climate risk at an asset-level. Received 24M in funding in May 2021, [in the news](https://www.eu-startups.com/2021/05/cervest-secures-e24-6-million-to-launch-new-ai-powered-climate-intelligence-platform/)

elements.title: CRREM
elements.description: Carbon Risk Real Estate Monitor (CRREM)  faces the challenge to estimate risk and uncertainty associated with real estate decarbonization, building a methodological body and empirically quantify the different scenarios and their impact on the investor portfolios. GRESB is in the consortium
